content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a restaurant in Boston that eats Boston lobster and asks for a rating of 4.6 or higher, and check out what a one-star review says.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/maps/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To start the task, I first need to search for restaurants in Boston that offer Boston lobster and have a rating of 4.6 or higher. I should use the search bar to enter relevant keywords.
Action: Type [0]; Boston restaurant Boston lobster rating 4.6 or higher
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [0]; Boston restaurant Boston lobster rating 4.6 or higher

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first restaurant, "Boston Sail Loft," matches the requirements: it's in Boston, offers lobster, and has a rating of 4.6. I now need to view its reviews to find a one-star review and see what it says.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to check the reviews for Boston Sail Loft to find and report a one-star review. The "Reviews" tab should provide access to individual reviews, including those with one star.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a one-star review, I should filter the reviews to show only those with 1 star. There is a "1" button for one-star reviews in the filter section.
Action: Click [37]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have already filtered for one-star reviews, but the contents of the reviews are not visible yet. I need to scroll down to see the specific content of the one-star review(s).
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review content area is still hidden and needs to be scrolled further down to display the one-star reviews for Boston Sail Loft. This will help me read an example of such a review for the answer.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The one-star reviews are still not visible; the reviews section needs further scrolling to reveal their contents so I can read and report the text of a one-star review.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Despite previous scrolls, the actual customer review text is still not visible in the reviews panel. Further scrolling is necessary to reveal the content of the one-star reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible area still does not show the actual customer review comments, especially the text contents of the one-star reviews. I need to continue scrolling down the page to display the one-star review text.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review section showing the actual text of one-star reviews is still not visible in the current screenshot, indicating more scrolling is still required. Focusing on the reviews panel area, continued scrolling should reveal the review content soon.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The actual one-star review text is still not visible in the review panel. Scrolling further down will likely reveal the customer comments.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible part of the reviews panel does not show any review text yet. The review section likely requires more scrolling to finally expose the content of one-star reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review contents are still not visible in the reviews panel, which means more scrolling is necessary to reveal customer comments, especially one-star reviews. The scroll bar on the reviews panel indicates more content below.
Action: Scroll [28]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review filter and tag options are visible, but there is still no review text shown. The scrollbar indicates that more content is available below, so scrolling further in the review panel should reveal the actual one-star customer reviews.
Action: Scroll [28]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The customer review section is now partially visible, as indicated by the appearance of a user (Vy H.) and a user profile button. The actual review content should be immediately below. Scrolling a bit more in this review panel will help fully reveal the review text.
Action: Scroll [35]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.99
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review contents are finally visible in the right panel, but this review shows 5 stars (not a 1-star review). I need to continue scrolling down within the reviews panel to find a one-star review as required by the task.
Action: Scroll [29]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.99
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The review comments area is open and showing positive reviews. I still need to scroll down further in the reviews panel to locate and reveal a one-star review for Boston Sail Loft, as required by the task.
Action: Scroll [29]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.99
